result.answer_text:
To convert kilometers to miles, you can use the conversion factor: 1 kilometer is approximately 0.621371 miles.

So, to convert 100 kilometers to miles:
\[ 100 \text{ km} \times 0.621371 \text{ miles/km} = 62.1371 \text{ miles} \]

Next, to calculate how many minutes it would take to travel 62.1371 miles at 60 miles per hour, you can use the formula:
\[ \text{Time (hours)} = \frac{\text{Distance (miles)}}{\text{Speed (miles per hour)}} \]

\[ \text{Time (hours)} = \frac{62.1371 \text{ miles}}{60 \text{ miles per hour}} = 1.0356185 \text{ hours} \]

To convert hours to minutes, multiply by 60:
\[ 1.0356185 \text{ hours} \times 60 \text{ minutes/hour} = 62.13711 \text{ minutes} \]

So, it would take approximately 62.14 minutes to travel 100 kilometers at 60 miles per hour.
